children.name: shape
children.definition: the shape that sth is, for example a square, a circle etc: hình dạng
examples: You can get pasta in lots of different shapes.
What shape is the swimming pool?
The fruits are similar in shape and size to plums
The desks form a U-shape, so that the teacher can interact easily with the students.
The pool was custom built, it is an unusual shape
If a mole changes color or shape, see a doctor.
What shape is the table?
You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
round/square etc in shape
The dining room was square in shape.
His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
in the shape of something
a silver pin in the shape of a large bird
The plants grow inevery shape and size.
The children cut out shapes(= squares, triangles etc )from the piece of cardboard.
out of shape
The wheel had been bent out of shape.

children.name: form
children.definition: the shape of sth - use this especially to talk about art or when the shape is not very clear: hình dạng
examples: Sleeping forms lay in groups and rows on the earth floor.
The painting consists of a series of interlocking forms.
form of
the shadowy forms of the divers swimming below the boat
in the form of sth
The main staircase was in the form of a big ‘S’.
Thefemale formis a thing of beauty.

children.name: silhouette
children.definition: the dark shape of sb/sth seen against a bright background:bóng, hình bóng, bóng hình đen
examples: The trees were silhouettes in the morning fog.
silhouette of
I saw the silhouette of someone waiting under the streetlight..

children.name: outline
children.definition: a line around the edge of sth which shows its shape :đường nét, hình dáng, nét ngoài
examples: outline of
The outline of a footprint was visible in the snow.
On the envelopes had been stamped the outlines of Santa Claus, holly, and a reindeer.
The outlines of animals were cut into the rock.
anoutline mapof Europe
in outline
figures drawn in outline
a vague/dim outline(= difficult to see )I could just make out a vague outline of a barn.
a blurred outline(= unclear )Through the spaces between the bars he saw the blurred outline of the oil derrick high in the sky.
a clear/sharp outlinePeeling off the tape after the paint has dried leaves a clear outline to the shapes.
draw an outlineFirst, I draw out the outline of the leaf onto paper, and start adding areas of colour.
trace an outline(= draw the outline of something, usually with your finger or toe )She traced the outline of his lips with her fingers.
an outline mapan outline map of the island
an outline drawing/sketchOnce I am happy with the outline sketch, I start painting.

children.name: contour
children.definition: the outer shape of sth, that has a lot of curves, especially an area of land or a person’s body: đường viền, đường quanh
examples: The seat is adjustable to fit the contours of your back.
A topographical map shows the contours of the earth’s surface.

children.name: line
children.definition: the outer shape of sth long or tall, especially sth that looks very graceful or attractive: nét
examples: The dress’s flowing lines are attractive on most women.
lines of
He noticed the long, slim lines of her legs beneath the colorful cotton skirt.

children.name: be round in shape
children.definition: be round/square/rectangular etc use this to say what shape sth is:
examples: The windows were round, like the windows on a ship.
'What shape is the table?’ ‘It’s long and rectangular.’
be round/square etc in shape
There was another building, octagonal in shape, close by.

children.name: shaped
children.definition: use this to say that sth has the same shape as sth else :
examples: star-shaped/heart-shaped/L-shaped etc
▪ He gave me a necklace with a heart-shaped locket.
▪ Gus lived in an apartment in a U-shaped courtyard.
shaped like
▪ On the table were salt and pepper shakers shaped like teddy bears.

children.name: in the shape of sth
children.definition: use this to say that sth has the same shape as sth else:
examples: a beautiful blue bowl in the shape of a flower
There was a big chocolate cake in the shape of a heart on the main table.

children.name: having no clear or exact shape
shapeless
children.definition: sth, especially a piece of clothing, that is shapeless has no clear or definite shape, and often looks unattractive: kì dị, kì quái
examples: He was wearing a shapeless grey coat which really did not fit him.
People trudged on, carrying shapeless bundles full of clothes or bedding.

children.name: amorphous
children.definition: formal having no definite shape that can be described or recognized because everything you can see is unclear or is mixed together: vô định hình
examples: The molten rock hardens into amorphous forms.
In her later works, large, amorphous shapes seem to float on the canvas.

children.name: regular
children.definition: evenly shaped with parts or sides of equal size: đều nhau
examples: Draw a regular hexagon with 90 mm sides.
She was attractive rather than beautiful, with regular features and dark hair.

children.name: symmetrical
children.definition: if sth is symmetrical, its two halves, on either side of a central line, are exactly alike:đối xứng
examples: ▪ The leaves of most trees are symmetrical in shape.
▪ Palladio built the Villa Rotunda following a symmetrical plan.
symmetry[U]sự đối xứng
▪ the delicate symmetry of a snowflake

children.name: to make sth into a particular shape
form
children.definition: to make sth into a particular shape, especially with your hands:
examples: ▪ She cut away the corners to form a circle.
form something into something
▪ With a few clever twists, he had formed the balloon into the shape of a dog.

children.name: mould
children.definition: British /mold American /məʊld/  to make clay or some other soft material into a particular shape by pressing it or putting it into a special hollow object:
examples: ▪ Her movements were quick and graceful, like those of a potter moulding clay.
mould something into something
▪ Mould the sausage meat into little balls.
moulded/molded[adjective]
▪ a tool with a moulded rubber handle

children.name: shape
children.definition: /ʃeɪp/  to make a soft material into a particular shape, especially by using your hands:
examples: ▪ Gel is great for holding and shaping shorter hairstyles.
shape something into something
▪ She had soaked the leather to bend and shape it into the form of a small shoe.

children.name: crescent
children.definition: a curved shape that is wider in the middle and pointed at the ends : hình lưỡi liềm
examples: a small crescent of pastry topped with cheese
crescent[adj]
the crescent moon

children.name: heart
children.definition: a shape used to represent a heart: hình trái tim

children.name: square
children.definition: any square-shaped objectvật hình vuông
examples: When cooled, cut the chocolate brownies into squares.

children.name: bar
children.definition: nounLONG PIECE thanh, thỏi
examples: a substance that has been made into a solid, rectangular shape
a bar of soap
a chocolate bar

children.name: spot
children.definition: nounCIRCLE chấm tròn
examples: one of many spots, that form a pattern
_I wore that skirt with the green spots.

children.name: pattern
children.definition: nounDRAWING mẫu vẽ
examples: [ C ] a drawing or shape used to show how to make something
_a knitting pattern
_a dress pattern
_Cut out all of the pieces from the paper pattern and pin them on the cloth.

children.name: format
children.definition: the size, shape, design etc, in which sth such as a book or magazine is produced : khổ, định dạng
examples: a large-format book for the partially-sighted.

children.name: take shape
children.definition: to start to develop a more clear or certain form
examples: We watched the vase begin to take shape in the potter's hands.
Our ideas are beginning to take shape.
An idea was beginning to take shape in his mind.

children.name: having a strange or wrong shape
deformed
children.definition: /dɪˈfɔːʳmd/  something that isdeformed, especially part of a living thing, has the wrong shape, usually because it has grown or developed wrongly:bị biến dạng
examples: ▪ She had survived polio, but her right leg was weak and deformed.
Cô ấy đã sống qua cơn bại liệt, nhưng chân phải của cô ấy rất yếu và bị biến dạng
▪ The desert plants were strange deformed bushes with bizarrely twisted branches.
Những cây cối ở sa mạc là những bụi rậm bị biến dạng với những cành cây vị soắn lại một cách ki lạ
deformity [countable/uncountable noun]dị dạng
▪ The drug was shown to cause deformity in a high proportion of babies born to mothers taking it.
Các bác sĩ cho biết thuốc mà người mẹ dùng gây ra dị dạng ở tỉ lệ cao đối với trẻ em mới được sinh ra

children.name: distorted
children.definition: /dɪˈstɔːʳtɪd, dɪˈstɔːʳtəd/  sth that is distortedhas been twisted out of its correct or original shape:bóp méo
examples: ▪ As a result of the crash, the remains of the vehicles were distorted out of all recognition.
▪ After treatment, her distorted hip had straightened, so that her legs were the same length.

children.name: misshapen
children.definition: having the wrong shape, usually because of growing that way over a long period of time:méo mó, xấu xí
examples: The old woman’s fingers were misshapen and useless.
Misshapen carrots and potatoes were fed to the pigs.

children.name: lopsided
children.definition: /ˌlɒpˈsaɪdɪd◂, ˌlɒpˈsaɪdəd◂ǁˌlɑːp-/  sth that is lopsided does not have the same shape on each side, for example because one side is higher than the other:lệch
examples: ▪ She gave me a lopsided smile.
▪ a note written in a child’s lopsided handwriting
▪ His whole face was lopsided, one cheek badly scarred.

children.name: lose its shape
children.definition: especially UK if sth such as a hat, coat, or skirtloses its shape,it becomes the wrong shape because it has been worn a lot:biến dạng
examples: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
She was wearing an old jumper that had lost its shape.

children.name: having a shape that is not regular
irregular
children.definition: unevenly shaped with parts or sides of unequal size:không đồng đều
examples: ▪ Lake Powell’s irregular coastline has many unspoiled beaches and secluded inlets.
▪ I recognized the doctor’s messy, irregular handwriting.
irregularly[adv]
▪ a large, irregularly shaped room

children.name: asymmetrical
children.definition: if something isasymmetrical, one half of it is not the same as the other - used in formal and technical contexts:không đối xứng
examples: The design of the house is consciously asymmetrical with a large tower at one end.
